column4: how do i know which graphics drivers i should install for my graphics card
nvidia-glx-legacy
thank you
how did you know that btw
i had an older card about same version
ah i see, thanks
i was reading the document.. and it said to run sudo nvidia-xconfig, but i tried and it says command not found
it should be pulled in when you sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-legacy
really? :s i just did apt-get isntall nvidia-glx-legacy =(
do i really need it? can i just edit my xorg.conf file ?
no you can setup xorg and stuff but go ahead and sudo apt-get install nvidia-xconfig   then run that other command
yeah it makes a new one and backs old one up sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart now and test
alright thanks
it displays a console on boot up.. when i type startx.. the screen goes really black
you there?
yeah
how did you get your card to work? all i get is a dead screen after i type startx into console at start.
usually all i need to do is apt-get the glx package and thats it. what does /var/log/Xorg.0.log say?
what should i look out for
this caught my eye, (EE) Failed to initialize GLX extension (NVIDIA X driver not found)
that would catch my eye too :) ive gotta replicate a few things for work real quick so maybe somone else here has suggestion
oh ok then, thanks =)
